Description: Round-topped limestone stela of Tsia; pilasters and shell; five lines of Greek text. Description in Hall: Complete degradation of temple 'in antis' type: the pillasters remain, but the pediment and akroteria have disappeared, and in their place is a semicircle of floreated and beaded bands, surrounding a shell. The architrave has become a band with guilloche decoration. Inscription ona rectangular panel between the two fluted and twisted pilasters.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.135, Pl.97)
Tudor 2011 / Christian Funerary Stelae of the Byzantine and Arab Periods from Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 97:3 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
